Context:
* Augmented Education is a free employment-focused program for individuals with mental health challenges and addiction histories.
* The program offers two streams: Construction Craft Worker Foundations Program (A106) and Culinary Skills (Preparatory Training) Program (A110).
* The Construction Craft Worker Foundations Program is a supportive employment-based program that helps individuals with barriers to training and employment transition to meaningful and sustainable work in Toronto's construction industry.
* The program is 20 weeks long, running from the beginning of April to the end of August.
* Graduates are awarded an Ontario College Certificate and qualified for entry-level construction jobs in the building trades including positions in construction labor, carpentry, masonry, cement finishing, construction retail and warehousing.
* Applications for Spring 2024 are currently being accepted with a deadline of February 9, 2024 by 11:59 p.m.
file_path: scraped_pages/otherpages/Augmented Education - Preparatory and Liberal Studies | George Brown College.txt

Context:
Title: Culinary Skills (Preparatory Training) Program (A106)
Description: A supportive, employment-based program for individuals with mental health challenges and addiction histories to help them transition to meaningful and sustainable work in Toronto's food service industry.
Duration: 8 months long, runs from the beginning of September to the end of April.
Location: Toronto, Ontario, Canada.
Application Deadline: July 5, 2024, by 11:59 p.m.
Certificate Awarded: Upon successful completion, participants will receive an Ontario College Certificate and be qualified for entry-level jobs in commercial food service industries like cafeterias, fast food outlets, restaurants, and catering operations.
